column1: Just as the front of the car approached
column2: Frank Merriwell received a push from behind that sent him flat upon the track directly in front of the car wheels!That particular car did not have a fender
column3: and it seemed that Frank must be mangled beneath the wheels. The motorman saw the lad go down and put on the brake hard
column4: but he could not stop the car in time.Frank realized that he had been pushed upon the track by someone whose deliberate purpose it was to maim or murder him
column5: but he could not save himself. He struck the paving
column6: and the iron wheels seemed right upon him.But Jack Diamond moved with marvelous quickness. He made a grasp at Frank as the latter fell
column9: grasped his coat and yanked Merry from the track.
